title: Failed IPOs knock wind out of banker bonuses
text:
Lost face isn't the only thing suffered when an initial public offering fails to garner enough interest to hit the boards.

Perhaps of more concern, the investment bankers who worked on the deal don't get paid.

The icing on the paycheck cake is in jeopardy for investment bankers after a string of failed IPOs. William Meppem

And with bonuses traditionally calculated on December 31, a weaker IPO season could take the icing off the paycheck cake for many.

Street Talk's back of the envelope calculations point to about $54.5 million in fees forgone from the failed IPOs of PropertyGuru, Latitude Financial, MPC Kinetic and Retail Zoo. Of the banks, UBS is the biggest loser, being involved in three of those four offerings.

From the $54.5 million total, around $40 million was in guaranteed management fees and up to another $14.5 million in incentive fees.
description: As Christmas bonus time nears, a string of failed IPOs could take the icing off the pay cake for investment bankers.
